intro: Hirtella triandra subsp. triandra, commonly known as the red-veined hirtella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves with prominent red veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which bloom during the warmer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
